subject: Programming
title: Why We Keep Repeating Mistakes
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Why We Keep Repeating Mistakes.

hook.text: Race conditions crashed Therac-25 in 1985 and the Northeast power grid in 2003.

buildup.text: The same categories of bugs â€” overflows, race conditions, missing checks â€” appear decade after decade.

discovery.text: New developers rarely study old failures. They learn languages and frameworks, not disaster history.

twist.text: Organizations lose institutional memory when senior engineers leave or teams reorganize.

climax.text: History doesn't repeat, but the bugs rhyme. Learning from failure is the only real defense.

punchline.text: Those who don't study old bugs are doomed to ship them.

quiz.question: Why do the same types of software bugs keep appearing?
options: New developers don't study past failures
